Boston.com
10

2 killed in South Boston fire

An early-morning apartment fire at 4 Linsky Barry Court killed a man and a woman, officials said. No other injuries were reported. (Globe, 10:21 a.m.)

Pedestrian struck, killed in Newton

A New Hampshire man was struck by a pickup truck on Nonantum Road at about 3:18 a.m. and later died at a Boston hospital, police said. (Globe, 10:29 a.m.)

It's been five weeks since the 2-year-old vanished on a Rockport beach; grief, anger, and a thread of hope have defined her family's life since. (Boston Globe)

Some municipal workers earn 6-figures

In several communities south of Boston, between 3 and 5 percent of all municipal employees pull in $100,000 or more in their jobs, according to a Globe survey. (Globe)

Rajon Rondo leads

Hospitals urged to apologize, settle

The ‘‘disclosure, apology, and offer’’ approach is the cornerstone of a new initiative to improve the state’s cumbersome and costly malpractice system.

Attacking student loan debt

Not only are today’s student loan balances daunting, but the process is confusing and the rules keep changing.

Mass. solar energy industry flourishing

The state is undergoing an unlikely boom, attracting companies from around the country that are installing systems for homeowners, businesses, and institutions.

Primary rival may distract Warren

As Mass. Democrats head to a state convention, party leaders fear that Elizabeth Warren will be blocked from fully engaging Senator Brown.
Opinion | Yvonne Abraham

Tending to the departed

As people washed headstones, pulled weeds, and tended geraniums at Pine Grove Cemetery in Lynn, the joy and pain of life with their loved ones flooded back.

Politics

Polls on gay marriage not
yet reflected in votes

Public support for same-sex marriage is steadily increasing to the point where it's now a majority viewpoint. Yet in the states where gay marriage has been on the ballot, voters have rejected it.

Business

Shreve, Crump & Low reopens

Luxury jeweler Shreve, Crump & Low moved its flagship Boston store to 39 Newbury St. The store opened on Monday after operating at 440 Boylston St. for seven years.
